channel.title: Connecting help
channel.description:
hello i want a help with connecting on my webclient i have made a webclient using this code [code]<HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE>Your Webclient</TITLE> <META HTTP-EQUIV="PRAGMA" CONTENT="NO-CACHE"> </HEAD>
<BODY>
<applet name="Extreme-Scape" width="765" height="503" archive="http://www.fileden.com/files/2011/10/18/3210965/Client.jar" code="client.class"> <param name="java_arguments" value="-Xmx1024m"> </applet>
</BODY> </HTML>[/code] [img]http://gyazo.com/be8dfb0d346ccd9f6dc238aaa0c886fc.png?1338526748[/img] [Note]i jarred the mainfest Gui i tried connecting using the client.jar it connected using the ip but i tried again jarring again with Client it connected with local host and btw the server ip is in Gui]] it had no problem for me it downloaded cache loaded and i connected but when i saw the Run Box it said logged in from 127.0.0.1 so i gave it to a player and they said it downloaded cache and everything but it said error connecting to server for them and my server is online cuse they can login using the client.jar i tryed changing the client.jar in the code to Gui it gave me error
note: i had this problem with my old source [Delta] and it never worked me so i got another delta and still the same problem

item.title: Connecting help
item.dc:creator: @mostwanted8 mostwanted8
item.description:
@mostwanted8 wrote:

exacly the ip for the server is in the Gui it sets the server ip how do i change it so i make the client sets it

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“mostwanted8, post:5, topic:443595”]oops i meant client had error connecting to server and
Gui connected normally cuse the server ip is inside it.[/quote]

Again, the Gui doesn’t connect…
Let me show you something.

They grey box is the Gui
Everything in it. is the client.
The Gui may set the IP for the client. But it physically does not connect.
Try setting the IP in the Gui to what ever you want it to be, then making a web client with manifest class client.

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting help
item.dc:creator: @mostwanted8 mostwanted8
item.description:
@mostwanted8 wrote:

oops i meant client had error connecting to server and
Gui connected normally cuse the server ip is inside it.

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Um. How do I explain this. Gui can’t have error connecting to server…
Gui has nothing to do with the physical game… It only is the box that surrounds the gameframe…

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting help
item.dc:creator: @mostwanted8 mostwanted8
item.description:
@mostwanted8 wrote:

i tried loading with both client and gui
client connected using 127.0.0.1
gui had error connecting to server

and this is the code in the gui that i found that sets the server ip

[code] private Gui(String args[])
{
super();
try
{

System.out.println(“connecting to update server”);
Serverip = “extreme-scape.no-ip.info”;
sign.signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getByName(Serverip));

		initUI();




	} 
	catch(Exception ex)
	{
		ex.printStackTrace();
	}
}


[/code]

how do i change it so i place it in client.java

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

  1. Jar it using the manifest of client class.
  2. Your server ip can be located in client.java by searching “server =” what you have in Gui.java is just something that changes it for you.
  3. You need to upload the client to your website itself. Not fileden, it will run better and more smooth.
  4. the Gui does absolutely nothing in a webclient because it cannot be seen.
    5)[quote=“mostwanted8, post:1, topic:443595”]archive=“http://www.fileden.com/files/2011/10/18/3210965/Client.jar” code=“client.class”>[/quote]
    Why are you having it load client.class if you set it to gui.class?
    Just saying.

Read full topic
